prompt: How do I make classic pancakes?
response: To make classic pancakes, mix 1 cup all-purpose flour, 2 tbsp sugar, 2 tsp baking powder, and 1/2 tsp salt in a bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together 1 cup milk, 1 egg, and 2 tbsp melted butter. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and stir until just combined. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it. Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake onto the skillet. Cook until bubbles form and the edges are set; flip and cook until golden on both sides. Serve warm with maple syrup, fresh berries, or a pat of butter.

prompt: What is a good vegetarian lasagna recipe?
response: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). In a pan, sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves garlic, and 2 cups chopped spinach until wilted. In a bowl, mix 2 cups ricotta cheese, 1 egg, 1/2 tsp salt, and pepper. In a baking dish, spread a layer of marinara sauce, then layer cooked lasagna noodles, ricotta mixture, sautéed vegetables, and shredded mozzarella. Repeat layers, finishing with mozzarella and a sprinkle of Parmesan. Bake for 45 minutes covered with foil, then uncover and bake another 10 minutes until cheese is golden and bubbly. Let stand 15 minutes before slicing.

prompt: How can I substitute eggs in baking?
response: Eggs can be substituted in baking using various ingredients. For each egg, try: 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce, 1/4 cup mashed banana, 1 tablespoon ground flaxseed mixed with 3 tablespoons water (let sit 5 minutes), or 1/4 cup plain yogurt. For leavening, 2 tbsp water + 1 tbsp oil + 2 tsp baking powder can replace one egg. Note that results may vary based on the recipe.

prompt: Give me a gluten-free bread recipe.
response: Mix 2 cups gluten-free flour blend, 1 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp salt, 1 tbsp instant yeast, 1 1/4 cups warm water, 2 tbsp olive oil, and 2 eggs. Combine until smooth. Pour into a greased loaf pan, cover, and let rise for 30-45 minutes. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 35-40 minutes until golden and hollow-sounding. Cool before slicing. Optional: Add 1/4 cup sunflower seeds or chopped nuts for texture.

prompt: How do I make vegan chocolate chip cookies?
response: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). In a bowl, mix 1/2 cup melted coconut oil, 1/2 cup brown sugar, and 1/4 cup non-dairy milk. Stir in 1 tsp vanilla. Add 1 1/2 cups flour, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, and 1/2 cup vegan chocolate chips. Mix until just combined. Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes. Let cool before removing from tray.

prompt: What can I make with chicken and rice?
response: Try a chicken and rice casserole: Sauté 1 lb chicken pieces with 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic in olive oil until browned. Add 1 cup uncooked rice, 2 cups chicken broth, 1 cup mixed vegetables (like peas and carrots), salt, pepper, and a pinch of paprika. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer on low for 20-25 minutes until rice is tender. Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

prompt: How do I cook pasta al dente?
response: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil (about 1 tbsp salt per 4 liters of water). Add pasta and stir occasionally. Begin tasting the pasta 2 minutes before the package's minimum time. Al dente pasta should be firm to the bite but not hard or crunchy. Drain immediately and do not overcook.

prompt: Can you suggest a keto-friendly dinner?
response: Sure! Try grilled salmon with a creamy garlic butter sauce. Serve with sautéed spinach and roasted cauliflower mash. For the mash: Boil cauliflower florets until tender, drain, then blend with butter, cream, salt, and pepper. Add a side salad with avocado and olive oil dressing for extra healthy fats.

prompt: How do I make a simple tomato soup?
response: Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic in 2 tbsp olive oil until soft. Add 4 cups chopped fresh tomatoes (or 1 can whole tomatoes), 2 cups vegetable broth, salt, pepper, and 1 tsp sugar. Simmer for 20 minutes. Blend until smooth, return to heat, and add a splash of cream or coconut milk. Serve hot with fresh basil and croutons.

prompt: What should I do if my cake is too dry?
response: If your cake is dry, brush it with simple syrup (equal parts sugar and water boiled until dissolved), or serve with whipped cream, custard, or fruit compote. For future cakes, avoid overbaking and measure flour properly by spooning and leveling.

prompt: How do I make homemade pizza dough?
response: Combine 2 cups bread flour, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp sugar, and 2 tsp instant yeast. Add 1 cup warm water and 1 tbsp olive oil. Knead for 8 minutes until smooth. Place in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise until doubled, about 1 hour. Punch down, shape, and add toppings. Bake at 475°F (245°C) for 12-15 minutes.

prompt: Give me a recipe for French onion soup.
response: Thinly slice 4 large onions. In a heavy pot, melt 3 tbsp butter and add onions with a pinch of salt. Cook on low, stirring often, until deeply caramelized (30-40 min). Add 1 clove minced garlic and cook 1 min. Pour in 1/2 cup dry white wine, scrape up browned bits, then add 4 cups beef broth, 1 bay leaf, and a few thyme sprigs. Simmer 20 min. Remove herbs, season to taste. Serve in bowls with toasted baguette slices and melted Gruyère cheese on top.

prompt: What is a good side dish for grilled steak?
response: Roasted garlic mashed potatoes pair well with grilled steak. Boil peeled potatoes until tender, then mash with roasted garlic, butter, cream, salt, and pepper. Add chopped chives for freshness. Alternatively, try a classic Caesar salad or grilled asparagus.

prompt: How do I make a vegan Alfredo sauce?
response: Sauté 2 cloves garlic in 2 tbsp olive oil. Add 1 1/2 cups unsweetened plant milk, 1/2 cup raw cashews (soaked and blended), 2 tbsp nutritional yeast, 1 tbsp lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Simmer 5 min, then blend until smooth. Toss with cooked pasta and steamed broccoli.

prompt: How can I tell if my bread dough has risen enough?
response: Gently press a finger into the dough. If the indentation springs back slowly and incompletely, the dough is ready. If it springs back quickly, let it rise longer. Over-proofed dough may collapse easily and have large bubbles.

prompt: What are some common baking mistakes and how can I avoid them?
response: Common baking mistakes include inaccurate measuring, overmixing, and overbaking. Always use measuring cups and spoons for dry and wet ingredients. Mix batters until just combined unless otherwise stated. Check for doneness a few minutes before the minimum baking time. Use an oven thermometer for accuracy.

prompt: How do I make homemade hummus?
response: In a food processor, combine 1 can drained chickpeas, 1/4 cup tahini, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 clove garlic, juice of 1 lemon, and 1/2 tsp salt. Blend until smooth, adding 2-4 tbsp cold water for creaminess. Garnish with paprika and extra olive oil.

prompt: What can I use instead of buttermilk?
response: For 1 cup buttermilk, use 1 cup milk plus 1 tbsp lemon juice or white vinegar. Stir and let sit 5-10 minutes until slightly thickened. This works well for pancakes, cakes, and biscuits.

prompt: How do I make risotto?
response: Heat 4 cups chicken or veggie broth. In a pan, sauté 1 chopped onion in 2 tbsp butter. Add 1 1/2 cups Arborio rice, stir to coat. Add 1/2 cup dry white wine; cook until mostly absorbed. Add broth 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly and letting it absorb before adding more. After 18-20 min, when rice is creamy and al dente, stir in 1/2 cup grated Parmesan, salt, and pepper. Optional: Add peas, mushrooms, or shrimp.

prompt: How do I make a chocolate ganache?
response: Heat 1 cup heavy cream just to a simmer, then pour over 8 oz chopped dark chocolate. Let stand 2 minutes, then whisk until smooth. Let cool for a glaze, or chill and whip for a frosting.

prompt: Give me a recipe for lemon bars.
response: For the crust: Mix 1 cup flour, 1/4 cup powdered sugar, and 1/2 cup softened butter. Press into a greased 8x8 pan. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 18-20 min. For filling: Whisk 1 cup sugar, 2 eggs, 2 tbsp flour, 1/2 tsp baking powder, juice and zest of 1 lemon. Pour over crust, bake 20-25 min more. Cool, dust with powdered sugar, and slice.

prompt: How do I make a vinaigrette dressing?
response: Whisk together 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp vinegar (red wine or balsamic), 1 tsp Dijon mustard, 1/2 tsp honey, salt, and pepper. For extra flavor, add minced garlic or fresh herbs. Shake in a jar for easy blending.

prompt: Can you give me a recipe for stuffed bell peppers?
response: Cut tops off 4 bell peppers and remove seeds. In a skillet, cook 1/2 lb ground beef or turkey with 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic. Stir in 1 cup cooked rice, 1 cup tomato sauce, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Stuff peppers, place in a baking dish, top with cheese, and bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30-35 minutes.

prompt: How do I make creamy mashed potatoes?
response: Peel and cut 2 lbs potatoes. Boil in salted water until fork tender. Drain and mash with 1/2 cup warm milk, 4 tbsp butter, salt, and pepper. For extra creaminess, use a potato ricer and add a dollop of sour cream.

prompt: How do I separate egg yolks from whites?
response: Crack the egg and gently open over a bowl, letting the white drip into the bowl while keeping the yolk in the shell halves. Pass the yolk back and forth, letting the white fall away. Alternatively, use clean hands to let the white slip through your fingers.

prompt: What is the best way to store fresh herbs?
response: For leafy herbs (parsley, cilantro), trim stems and place in a jar with water, cover loosely with a plastic bag, and refrigerate. For woody herbs (rosemary, thyme), wrap in a damp paper towel and place in a resealable bag in the fridge.

prompt: How do I make a frittata?
response: Beat 6 eggs with salt and pepper. Sauté chopped vegetables (onion, bell pepper, spinach) in an oven-safe skillet with olive oil. Pour eggs over, cook until edges set. Sprinkle cheese on top. Transfer skillet to a 375°F (190°C) oven and bake until center is just set, about 10-12 min.

prompt: How do I make overnight oats?
response: In a jar, combine 1/2 cup rolled oats, 1/2 cup milk (any kind), 1/4 cup yogurt, 1 tbsp chia seeds, 1 tsp honey, and fruit. Stir, cover, and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, stir and add nuts or extra fruit if desired.

prompt: What can I use to thicken a soup?
response: To thicken soup, you can purée some of the soup and stir it back in, add a slurry of cornstarch and water, stir in instant potato flakes, or simmer uncovered to reduce. A roux (butter and flour cooked together) can also be used for creamy soups.
